glossary.surface: The written form as it appears (kanji/kana/latin). Example: 東京, する.
glossary.reading: The reading in kana (pronunciation). Example: とうきょう, する.

notes: Large datasets may be stored as JSONL.GZ chunk files (see the names manifest).
JSON files may be stored as .json or .json.gz; consumers should support both.

keys.reading: Kana reading (usually hiragana); may be absent for entries without reading.
keys.surface_norm: Normalized surface used for search-as-you-type indexing.
keys.reading_norm: Normalized reading used for search-as-you-type indexing.
